Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Reginald Belton of First Baptist Church of Brownsville, 357 Chester St, Brooklyn, NY 11212.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Ampry-Samuels.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Reginald Belton of First Baptist Church of Brownsville, 357 Chester Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11212. 

Council Member Ampry-Samuels moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 20, 2018 and Charter Meeting of January 9, 2019 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gjonaj.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Gjonaj, Council Member Richards moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 20, 2018 and the Charter Meeting of January 9, 2019 be adopted as printed.

Items.MatterName: Submitting the Preliminary Ten-Year Capital Strategy, Fiscal Years 2020-2029.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting Preliminary certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City, and the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, may soundly incur for capital projects for Fiscal Year 2020 and the ensuing three fiscal years, and the maximum amount of appropriations and expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year, pursuant to Section 250(16) of the New York City Charter.

Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

Introduction & Reading of Bills

Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring district attorneys to report on criminal prosecutions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Justice System
Items.MatterName: Requiring district attorneys to report on criminal prosecutions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to publish the department’s disciplinary guidelines and the number of officers disciplined each year, and to provide a disciplinary action report directly to the Council
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police dept to publish the dept’s disciplinary guidelines and the number of officers disciplined each year, and to provide a disciplinary action report directly to the Council.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to parking enforcement
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Parking enforcement.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to city vehicles obstructing a bicycle lane, bus lane, sidewalk, crosswalk, or fire hydrant
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: City vehicles obstructing a bicycle lane, bus lane, sidewalk, crosswalk, or fire hydrant.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting parking complaints to 311
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Reporting parking complaints to 311.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to city-issued parking permits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: City-issued parking permits.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to ensure that any law passed to legalize the market for the adult use of cannabis allows the City to enact its own regulatory measures on issues unique to its location including the home delivery and cultivation of cannabis in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Ensure that any law passed to legalize the market for the adult use of cannabis allows the City to enact its own regulatory measures on issues unique to its location including the home delivery and cultivation of cannabis in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fast food employee layoffs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Fast food employee layoffs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring community notification when a bike share station is installed or relocated
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring community notification when a bike share station is installed or relocated.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to underground storage tank protocols for city-owned and city permitted storage of biodiesel blends.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Underground storage tank protocols for city-owned and city permitted storage of biodiesel blends.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code, in relation to creation of a department of sustainability and climate change and repealing section 20 of chapter 1 of the New York city charter.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Creation of a department of sustainability and climate change and repealing section 20 of chapter 1 of the New York city charter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to creating renewable energy technologies board
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Creating renewable energy technologies board.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that reforms the property management of buildings in the Mitchell-Lama Housing Program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Legislation that reforms the property management of buildings in the Mitchell-Lama Housing Program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring social workers in child care centers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring social workers in child care centers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring school buses to operate in bus lanes during hours of operation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring school buses to operate in bus lanes during hours of operation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the New York State Office of Children and Family Services to develop a parents’ bill of rights to be distributed at initial home visits in child protective investigations and made available online.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Develop a parents’ bill of rights to be distributed at initial home visits in child protective investigations and made available online.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to pass legislation that grants New York City agencies the authority to regulate local licensing of the adult-use cannabis market in the City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Grants NYC agencies the authority to regulate local licensing of the adult-use cannabis market in the City.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of social services/human resources administration to report annually on comments, questions and complaints by clients
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of social services/human resources administration to report annually on comments, questions and complaints by clients.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to accommodation of food allergies and dietary restrictions in certain food service establishments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Accommodation of food allergies and dietary restrictions in certain food service establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a program for child visitors of department of correction facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Establishing a program for child visitors of department of correction facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring reports on preschool special education and early intervention services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring reports on preschool special education and early intervention services.

Items.Title: A Local Law, in relation to a study on single-use plastics
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: A study on single-use plastics.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to affordable retail space in financially assisted development projects, and to provide for the expiration of the provisions relating thereto
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Affordable retail space in financially assisted development projects, and to provide for the expiration of the provisions relating thereto.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a task force to address issues and consequences related to educator sexual abuse
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Establishing a task force to address issues and consequences related to educator sexual abuse.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to commercial tenant harassment
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Commercial tenant harassment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the number of vehicular travel lanes on a specified portion of Morris Park Avenue in borough of the Bronx
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Number of vehicular travel lanes on a specified portion of Morris Park Ave, Bronx.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing vehicles obstructing a sidewalk, crosswalk, fire hydrant, bicycle lane, or bus lane
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Removing vehicles obstructing a sidewalk, crosswalk, fire hydrant, bicycle lane, or bus lane.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation prohibiting vertical integration and promoting small business growth in the recreational marijuana industry.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting vertical integration and promoting small business growth in the recreational marijuana industry.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to granting district attorneys access to law enforcement records
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Justice System
Items.MatterName: Granting district attorneys access to law enforcement records.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on the number of arrests for resisting arrest or assault in the second degree
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Justice System
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police dept to report on the number of arrests for resisting arrest or assault in the second degree.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to wrongful discharge of fast food employees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Wrongful discharge of fast food employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass and for the Governor to sign legislation that prioritizes individuals with prior marijuana convictions in issuing licenses to sell recreational marijuana and requires other applicants for marijuana licenses to support the hiring of such individuals.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Legislation that prioritizes individuals with prior marihuana convictions in issuing licenses to sell recreational marihuana and requires other applicants for marihuana licenses to support the hiring of such individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to studying the feasibility of implementing solar-ready measures for commercial buildings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Studying the feasibility of implementing solar-ready measures for commercial buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of reusable beverage containers provided by customers at food service establishments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Use of reusable beverage containers provided by customers at food service establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the department of transportation to study the feasibility of acquiring private streets
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOT to study the feasibility of acquiring private streets.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring a study and report on 311 complaints resulting in unconfirmed conditions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Requiring a study and report on unsubstantiated 311 complaints.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to violations for standing water
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Violations for standing water.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that grants localities the authority to regulate public consumption of marijuana within their jurisdictions, including the authority to determine whether to enact any penalties and how to enforce such penalties.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Grants localities the authority to regulate public consumption within their jurisdictions, including the authority to determine whether to enact any penalties and how to enforce such penalties.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign a bill that remedies disparate burdens placed on people of color in the enforcement of marijuana prohibition by reinvesting tax revenue generated from legal marijuana in their communities and encouraging their participation in the legal marijuana industry.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Remedies disparate burdens placed on people of color in the enforcement of marijuana prohibition by reinvesting tax revenue generated from legal marijuana in their communities and encouraging their participation in the legal marijuana industry.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass and the President to sign S.1689, known as the "Marijuana Justice Act of 2017," which would amend the Controlled Substances Act to provide for a new rule regarding the application of the Act to marijuana, and for other purposes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Marijuana Justice Act of 2017 (S.1689)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation related to the reclassifying of THC and all other marijuana based products from a controlled substance to the equivalent of flower marijuana.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Reclassifying of THC and all other marijuana based products from a controlled substance to the equivalent of flower marijuana.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the publication of the NYPD auxiliary police guide
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the publication of the NYPD auxiliary police guide.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the fees charged in a rental real estate transaction
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Limiting the fees charged in a rental real estate transaction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting rental security deposits to one month of rent
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Limiting rental security deposits to one month of rent.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on investigations initiated by the administration for children’s services resulting from drug screenings performed at facilities managed by the New York city health and hospitals corporation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Reporting on investigations initiated by the administration for children’s services resulting from drug screenings performed at facilities managed by the New York city health and hospitals corporation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on arrests for obstruction of governmental administration
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police dept to report on arrests for obstruction of governmental administration.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a pilot program to provide bleeding control training and kits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Establishing a pilot program to provide bleeding control training and kits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to consider placement of traffic enforcement agents in developing an interagency roadway safety plan
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOT to consider placement of traffic enforcement agents in developing an interagency roadway safety plan.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Drug testing not permitted by the department of probation.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Providing tenants the option of paying a security deposit in six equal monthly installments.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Transparency in residential rental application fees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the return of security deposits within 14 days of the end of a lease
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring the return of security deposits within 14 days of the end of a lease.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation requiring the New York State Department of Health to create clear and fair regulations for hospitals on drug testing those who are pregnant or giving birth, including informing patients of their rights before any discussion of drug use or drug testing.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Hospitals
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYS Dept of Health to create clear and fair regulations for hospitals on drug testing those who are pregnant or giving birth, including informing patients of their rights before any discussion of drug use or drug testing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of back seat safety belts
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Use of back seat safety belts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the federal government and its legislators to move significant funds away from the military budget to fund human needs and services and that in-depth public hearings are conducted on the dollar amounts that the City needs but that get diverted to the Pentagon.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Federal government and its legislators to move significant funds away from the military budget to fund human needs and services.

Items.MatterName: Requiring DOI to notify the council when it requests an integrity monitor for existing contracts.

Items.MatterName: Authorizing the NYC DOT to grant a non-exclusive franchise for the provision of bus service between Manhattan and Staten Island.

Items.MatterName: Requiring DOI and the special commissioner of investigation to create web applications to track agency cooperation and compliance with investigations and recommendations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass legislation that would allow undocumented immigrants to obtain a driver's license regardless of their immigration status.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore  (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 4 Council Members formally noted their negative vote in opposition to this item:  
Council Members Borelli, Holden, Ulrich, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo);

The following Council Member formally noted his vote to abstain from this item:  
Council Member Yeger.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Allow undocumented immigrants to obtain a driver’s license regardless of their immigration status.

Items.Title: Resolution amending Rule 7.00 of the Rules of the Council in relation to dissolving the Committee on For Hire Vehicles and transferring the jurisdiction of For Hire Vehicles, expressly the Taxi and Limousine Commission, to the Standing Committee on Transportation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Amending Rule 7.00 of the Rules of the Council in relation to dissolving the Committee on For Hire Vehicles and transferring the jurisdiction of For Hire Vehicles, expressly the Taxi and Limousine Commission, to the Standing Committee on Transportation.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Administration for Children’s Services to implement a policy finding that a person’s mere possession or use of marijuana does not by itself create an imminent risk of harm to a child, warranting the child’s removal.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 49 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.

There is a vacancy in the Office of Public Advocate pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the citywide February 26, 2019 Special Election.

The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) assumed the chair as the Acting President Pro Tempore and presiding officer for these proceedings.
The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)

Items.Title: Application No. 20195394 HAM (East Village Homes – NCP) submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Article 16 of the General Municipal Law for an amendment of a previously approved Urban Development Action Area Project, for property located at Block 372, Lots 11 and 49, Borough of Manhattan, Council District 2, Community District 3.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Planning, Dispositions and Concessions
